name: Presentations by AJ Zane
body:
**I care about the web community and the awesome people who work really hard to create great tools, resources, and ideas. If my knowledge and experiences can help just one person get excited about web development, design, and/or engineering then I know I have helped to add one more great mind to the ever-expanding awesomeness that is the web.**

All my presentation slides are open to the public to learn from, review, and probably make fun of when they become dated.

If you'd like me to do a presentation at your event or for your organization, contact me at androiddreams@AJZane.com or [@azanebrain](http://twitter.com/azanebrain)

You should also check out the [organizations](/organizations) I'm a part of.

**[Advanced WordPress Meetup](https://www.facebook.com/groups/advancedwp/)**
The Advanced WordPress Meetup is a monthly round table session to share and learn about advanced WordPress topics. I regularly attend and contribute by helping out moderate the 10,000+ member FaceBook group. I will be sponsoring the November 2014 session.

**[Front End Authority](http://frontendauthority.org)**
"Front End Authority promotes the ongoing education of front end technologies. Part digital, part physical, we aim to bring like-minded pros and learners together to share knowledge, make connections, have some beers, and stay up to date on the constantly changing world of Front End Web Development."

## [Adobe Edge Tools and the Death of Web Development](adobeedge)
These slides explore how Adobe's Edge Tools can interact in the web development community. Do they provide a useful set of features that will be used religiously? Or do they replace the need for web developers?

June 19, 2014 | [Front End Web Dev](http://www.meetup.com/Front-end-Dev-North-County-San-Diego)

## [Full Stack CSS Workshop](http://slides.com/azanebrain/fullstack-css#/)

The FullStack Labs series is a quarter-long course in a web development topic combining a short presentation and interactive workshop. My presentation on CSS is part of the Web Basics course and has a self-teaching [codepen workshop](http://codepen.io/azanebrain/pen/axJkw?editors=110).

September 11, 2014 | [Full Stack Talks](http://fullstacktalks.com)

## [Advanced WordPress Sponsored by me](awp-014-11)
Slides and video from the Advanced WordPress session I sponsored.

November 19, 2014 | [Advanced WordPress](http://www.meetup.com/Advanced-WordPress/events/203465102/)

## [Foundation 5](foundation5)

These slides are a comprehensive intro to Foundation 5. Read them along with the Foundation docs. A demo is included.

January 16, 2014 | [Front End Web Dev](http://www.meetup.com/Front-end-Dev-North-County-San-Diego)

## [Foundation WordPress Boilerplate](foundationwpbp)

An interactive (and in progress) demo of making a WordPress theme form the static Foundation boilerplate

February 20, 2014 | [Front End Web Dev](http://www.meetup.com/Front-end-Dev-North-County-San-Diego)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
